headline: Taking herbal formulations after 14 days of preparation risky – NAFDAC
summarized_story:
THE Director General of the National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control, Prof. Mojisola Adeyeye, has warned Nigerians to avoid the risk of taking herbal formulations after 14 days of preparations.
Adeyeye explained that such measure was necessary for safety reasons, adding that such medicine should always be kept refrigerated.
The NAFDAC DG, in a statement by the agency’s Resident Media Consultant, Sayo Akintola, further said, “After 14 days, if it is liquid, it may start to develop bacteria that can make people sick.”She also advised Nigerians to be careful in using herbal medicine to prevent avoidable death and complications.
According to her, it is advisable to avoid simultaneous use of herbal and conventional medicine.
Adeyeye’s warning was contained in a message in Abuja to mark the World Herbal Medicine Day on Monday.

headline: MaxAB extends Series A to $55M, largest ever by an Egyptian startup

In addition, it announced its acquisition of WaystoCap, a Morocco-based e-commerce and distribution platform that connects retailers with suppliers across Africa.
Two years later, the company got into the 2017 Y Combinator’s Winter batch, making it the first company accepted from Morocco.

headline: Retirees bet N474bn in payment for life
summarized_story:
A set of retirees under the Contributory Pension Scheme (CPS) wishing to earn pensions for life has put down N474.1 billion premium with life insurance companies offering retiree life annuity.
Retiree Annuity or Annuity for life, as it is generally called, is a retirement instrument option for retiring employees offered by a life insurance company licensed by the National Insurance Commission (NAICOM).
It is a type of annuity contract that provides, in return for a lump sum, a monthly or quarterly payment starting immediately after retirement and continuing for the rest of the retiree’s life.
The insurance regulator has noted that an increase in premium of life companies offering annuity has seen the industry life premium grow by 37 percent since the beginning of 2014.
S. 7 (1a) Pension Reform Act 2014 states that an employee on retirement shall procure Annuity for Life Policy or Programmed Withdrawal.

The Zamfara Commissioner of Information, Ibrahim Dosara who disclosed this, said only vehicles should be attended to at petrol stations.
The armed forces have carried out operations and airstrikes on their camps, which are hidden deep in the forests that span Zamfara, Kaduna, Katsina and Niger States, but violence has escalated.
In July, the Air Force said bandits had shot down one of its jets as it was carrying out operations in Zamfara State.

headline: DSS Releases Eight Igboho’s Aides, Four Still In Custody
summarized_story:
The Department of State Services (DSS) has released eight of the 12 aides of Yoruba Nation agitator, Sunday Adeyemo, also known as Sunday Igboho, in its custody.
The detained persons have been in the custody of the security agency 61 days after they were arrested by security operatives in early July.
READ ALSO: DSS Confirms Raid On Igboho’s House, Parades 13 Suspected Armed Yoruba Nation AgitatorsThe DSS, however, refused to release the remaining four persons, contrary to an order of the court that granted bail to the entire 12 aides of the Yoruba Nation agitator in the custody of the agency.
The DSS had also confirmed the arrest of 13 persons, but 12 of them were paraded at its office in Abuja.
Despite the withdrawal, the DSS has only released eight of the 12 detained persons.

headline: Counter-Terrorism: Nigeria, Turkey To Strengthen Ties
summarized_story:
The Nigerian Army and its Turkish counterpart have pledged to strengthen military bilateral relations to tackle terrorism.
This was disclosed on Monday when the Turkish Ambassador to Nigeria, Hidaye Bayraktar visited the Chief of Army Staff, Lieutenant General Faruk Yahaya, at the Army Headquarters in Abuja.
Ambassador Bayraktar explained that like Nigeria, Turkey is confronted with challenges of insecurity, pointing out that a collaboration of both countries will curtail the activities of terrorists in both countries.
READ ALSO: We Do Not Enlist Former Terrorists, Says Nigerian ArmyHe added that Turkey was prepared to further assist Nigeria to fight insurgency using experiences from similar challengesThe Chief of Army Staff in response said the visit would further enhance the existing cordial relationship between Nigeria and Turkey.
General Yahaya further stated that the relationship between the two countries will bolster the capabilities of the armies of both countries through sharing of intelligence and operational experience.

headline: IBB University holds Natural Sciences Annual Conference
summarized_story:
The 2nd Faculty of Natural Sciences Annual Conference is currently holding at the IBB university Lapai.
The theme of the conference is Catalysing national economic recovery in post Covid 19 era through innovative research.
The conference by the faculty of Natural Sciences seeks to discover innovative ways to help revitalise the economy of Nigeria in the post Covid 19 era especially in waste management and job creation

headline: Delta Govt engages citizens on 2022 budget preparation -
summarized_story:
Delta state government has begun the process of the 2022 budget preparations with the commitment towards accountability and transparency by organising citizens budget engagement.
This is to ensure the active participation of critical stakeholders to making the final fiscal document a true reflection of the will of the people.
Commissioner for Economic planning in the state, Barry Gbe said that this engagement is a necessary process toward entrenching participatory governance in the state.
The state government is looking at a budget proposal of N425 billion and 90 percentage budget performance as economy recovers from the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic.

headline: Police recover missing teenager in Asaba
summarized_story:
The Delta State Police Command has found a missing teenager, Master Kachukwu Sunday in Asaba.
According to him, the teenager hailed from Agu-Achara Community in Ishielu Agba Local Government Area (LGA) of Ebonyi.
Edafe said that the teenager was found roaming on Abraka-Orogun Road by the State Anti-Kidnapping and Cyber Crime Squad (SAKCCS) Asaba.
“One Master Sunday, aged 13, height 3.5ft and dark in complexion was found roaming along Abraka-Orogun Road by the State Anti-Kidnapping and Cyber Crime Squad (SAKCCS) Asaba.
“Any person who knows the said boy should inform the parents or guardian to report to SAKCCS or PPRO’s office, Police Headquarters, Asaba, for identification,” he said.

headline: US Government to help unmask Boko Haram sponsors -
summarized_story:
The Government of the United States of America has said it is ready to help Nigeria identify the sponsors of Boko Haram.
This was disclose by the US Ambassador to Nigeria, Mary Leonard.
She said her country is prepared to partner with Nigeria to identify the sponsors of Boko Haram and extremism in the country.
I don’t actually think the two match up.”She said that the U.S. had remained committed to supporting Nigeria’s fight against insecurity.
Leonard added that the U.S. government was also committed to supporting democracy and economic programmes of the government through the embassy.

headline: I Stubbornly Published Accurate Data: Nigeria’s Former Statistician-General Yemi Kale
summarized_story:
A former Statistician-General of the Federation Dr Yemi Kale says he is “very stubborn” in ensuring that accurate data is being published not minding political attacks and involvement.
He was narrating his experience as Nigeria’s statistician-general after ten years at the helm of the National Bureau of Statistics.
Kale spoke to ARISE News on Tuesday and reacted to how he handled politicians in the country handled data released by the agency.
The renowned economist said he never really settled down in the office as he expected he could be sacked at any time.
He said that was the price he was prepared to pay for trying to do the job properly.

headline: Dangote: Fuelling Nigeria’s Future with the World’s Biggest Refinery
summarized_story:
In an exclusive report on how the world’s biggest refinery will transform Nigeria’s reliance on imported fuel, ARISE Special Correspondent Abisola Owolawi interviews Africa’s richest man, Aliko Dangote, and asks if his refinery will turn Nigeria’s oil curse into a blessing.
She also gets to explore the facility – the size of more than 6,000 football fields – to find out if Dangote’s venture is too big to fail.
Watch the insightful and engaging interview…

headline: South African Scientists Discover New Coronavirus Variant with Multiple Mutations
summarized_story:
South African scientists have detected a new coronavirus variant with multiple mutations but are yet to establish whether it is more contagious or able to overcome the immunity provided by vaccines or prior infection, the National Institute for Communicable Diseases (NICD) has said.
NICD scientists said on Monday C.1.2 was only “present at very low levels” and that it was too early to predict how it might evolve.
“[But] we have considerable confidence that the vaccines that are being rolled out in South Africa will continue to protect us against severe illness and death,” she added.
It is however not frequent enough to qualify as a “variant of interest” or a “variant of concern” such as the highly transmissible Delta and Beta variants, which emerged in South Africa late last year.
South Africa is the continent’s hardest-hit country with more than 2.7 million COVID-19 cases reported to date, of which at least 81,830 have been fatal.

headline: Taliban Says Afghanistan ‘Free Nation’ as It Hails US Exit
summarized_story:
The Afghan group says the US defeat is lesson for everyone else, and says it wants ‘good relations’ with the rest of the world.
The Taliban says Afghanistan is a “free and sovereign” nation as it hails the exit of US troops after 20 years of occupation, describing their departure as a “historic moment”.
Taliban fighters on Tuesday took charge of Kabul’s airport as the last US soldiers flew out of the country.
Speaking to reporters from Kabul airport on Tuesday, Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid said: “We do not have any doubt that the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan is a free and sovereign nation.
“America was defeated… and on behalf of my nation, we want to have good relations with the rest of the world,” he said.

headline: US Open: Naomi Osaka Wins in First Grand Slam Since French Open Withdrawal
summarized_story:
Defending champion Naomi Osaka claimed a straight-set victory at the US Open on her first Grand Slam appearance since withdrawing from the French Open.
Osaka withdrew from Roland Garros in May, revealing she had “suffered long bouts of depression” since winning her first major title at the 2018 US Open.
The four-time major champion decided not to play at Wimbledon in June but returned for the Tokyo Olympics, where she lost in the third round.
Former world number one Simona Halep made a winning return to Grand Slam tennis after missing the French Open and Wimbledon with a calf tear, beating Italian Camila Giorgi 6-4 7-6 (7-3).
French Open champion Barbora Krejcikova sealed her place in the second round by beating Australian Astra Sharma 6-0 6-4.
